intro: Nesopanax, commonly known as the arrowleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical regions of the Americas. These plants are characterized by their large, palmate leaves that resemble the shape of an arrowhead. The genus includes both trees and shrubs, often found in humid, lowland forests. Nesopanax species are valued for their ornamental foliage and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
